data.content:
noun
plural -parks
[count] :a park in which baseball games are played :a baseball park or stadium
hit a home run out of the ballpark
in the ballpark
informal :close to the correct or exact number, price, etc.
My first guess wasn't even in the ballpark. [=it was not close to being correct]
An offer of $5,000 would be in the (right) ballpark for this car. [=this car is worth about $5,000]
adjective
always used before a noun
not exact but close in number or amount :approximately correct
She gave us a ballpark price of $5,000. [=she said it could cost about $5,000]
We don't know exactly how many people live in this city, but a ballpark figure/estimate would be about two million.

Danh từ
(từ Mỹ) sân chơi bóng chày
a ballpark figure
(khẩu ngữ)
con số áng chừng
